headline: US Stock Market Today S&P 500 Futures Dip As Lower Yields Meet Cost Pressures
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Wednesday, Jan, 7 2026 US stock futures are slightly softer this morning, with the main S&P 500 contracts edging lower while volatility gauges like VIX futures sit around 16.3. The big global story is falling government bond yields in Europe and Poland, which point to easier borrowing costs for households and companies. At the same time, the US Services PMI at 52.5 and Composite PMI at 52.7 show the economy is still growing, just at a slower pace...

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Sandisk Flies Higher
summary: Sandisk soared 28% and is now up almost 900% since its spinoff from Western Digital in February.  Western Digital gained 17% and Seagate rose 14%.  Huang discussed a new memory-storage platform for Nvidia's latest artificial-intelligence server system, into which it has integrated a host of connectivity and memory-storage products.

headline: Is Western Digital (WDC) Pricing In Too Much After A 349% One Year Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether Western Digital is still reasonably priced after its huge run, this article will walk through what the current share price might be implying about future expectations. The stock closed at US$219.38 recently, with returns of 24.6% over the past week, 29.9% over the past month, 16.9% year to date, 349.3% over the last year and a very large gain over five years that is close to 7x. Recent price moves have been closely watched as Western Digital has remained in focus...
